content: mini scarf - crochet like knit tunisian crochet a claire crochet december 2024 1 1 introduction having been hooked on crochet pun tunisian crochet for the past few weeks i was looking for a tunisian crochet pattern inspired by the sophie scarf i was not able to find one so i decided to make one myself this short pattern shows you how to make a mini scarf in a knit-like look using tunisian crochet it expects that you know the basics of tunisian crochet and/or are willing to look up free online tutorials on how to make the different stitches itiswritteninaflexibleformat thatallowsyoutocustomizethescarf to your liking 2 what you ll need to make this mini scarf you ll need a tunisian crochet hook of your liking i used a size 8 tunisian crochet hookwithyarnattached butgiventhatthescarfismini youcanuseany type of tunisian crochet hook a standard crochet hook of your liking for the edging i used a size 6 standard crochet hook 1or2ballsofyarntoyourliking forreference myneckcircumferenceis about 40 cm and i used 1 ball of concept by katia cotton-merino wool in the colour 146 this resulted in a skinny scarf that i could tie once around my neck by adjusting the width and/or length of the middle part of the pattern you can create a longer scarf and may need to use additional yarn scarf and needle to finish off your piece youarealsoexpectedtobefamiliarwiththebasicsoftunisiancrochet casting on foundation row forward and return passes and the tunisian knit stitch we ll cover how i decided to increase and decrease but if this is new to you it is also recommended to look up how to do this 3 increase section 1 to start your mini scarf chain 2 then pick up 1 loop in the 2nd chain from the hoop you now should have two loops on your hook follow the standard return pass with one edging stitch for the two stitches 2 you ll now start using the tunisian knit stitch tks insert your needle in the correct vertical bars skipping the one below your current loop yarn over to get a second loop and repeat in the outer edge to end up with 3 loops return pass repeat this step once until your reach the final loop on the return pass 2 3 you llnowstartyourfirstincreasesection startingfromthefinalloopof thelastreturnpass firstyarnover firstincreasemade andthencontinue with tks until end of the forward pass you should now have 4 loops on your hook return pass as normal having made this increase row you will now make 2 tks row forward and return pass twice with these four loops 4 once you have finished the two row you will repeat these steps until your hook holds enough stitches to obtain the width of the scarf you like for reference i made a slightly wide mini scarf that does not need to be wrapped around twice and this meant that for my yarn and hook size i increased +2 extra row until i reached 11 stitches 11 loops on my hook 4 middle section
